contentrichtext.text: '''Yevhen Fedorovych Stankovych''' ({{lang-uk|Євген Федорович Станкович}}, born September 19, 1942) is a contemporary [[Ukrainians|Ukrainian]] [[composer]] of stage, orchestral, chamber, and choral works. His works have been performed around the globe. == Biography == Stankovych was born in [[Svaliava]], [[Ukraine]] (in the Transcarpathians). In 1962-63, he studied composition with Adam Soltys at the L'viv Mykola Lysenko Conservatoire. From 1965 to 1970 Yehven studied composition with [[Boris Lyatoshynsky]] and [[Myroslav Skoryk]] at the [[Kiev Conservatory]]. He has worked as a music editor, a chairman of the Ukrainian Composers' Union, and has been working as a professor of composition in the [[Kiev Conservatory]], now the National Music Academy of Ukraine, since 1998. == Works == Dr. Stankovych has also received many awards and honours for his compositions.
